title: ‘I Want To Kidnap You’: Uber Driver’s Text Leaves Gurugram Woman Terrified - News18
Cold wave reaches Hyderabad, parts of North India shiver in below 0 deg C | Key points - Hindustan Times
summary:
Cold Wave Reaches Hyderabad, Parts of North India Shiver in Below 0 deg C

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A cold wave is affecting many regions in India, including Telangana and Hyderabad, where temperatures have dipped significantly. Major cities are recording temperatures significantly below normal, with several areas experiencing severe cold conditions.

  • Delhi's Cold Snap: Recorded a minimum temperature of 4.5°C, prompting the reimposition of GRAP 4 restrictions due to poor air quality.
  • Freezing Temperatures in Kashmir: Srinagar recorded temperatures as low as -3.4°C.
  • Impact in Rajasthan: Fatehpur in Sikar district recorded lows of -0.4°C.
  • Conditions in Telangana: Hyderabad saw temperatures drop to 6.4°C with similar trends across the region.
  • Warnings Issued: Severe cold warnings have been issued for multiple states, with predictions of ongoing cold conditions.
“The prediction indicates a continuation of cold conditions with further drops in minimum temperatures expected across the region.”

The ongoing cold wave is anticipated to have lasting effects on both health and economic aspects for the affected regions, with additional warnings forecasting continued colder temperatures in the upcoming days.
newTitle: Cold Wave Hits Hyderabad and Parts of North India

title: One nation, one election: Bill to hold simultaneous polls to be introduced in Lok Sabha today - Hindustan Times
summary:
One nation, one election: Bill to hold simultaneous polls to be introduced in Lok Sabha today

Date: Today Source: Hindustan Times

The Lok Sabha will discuss a constitutional amendment bill aimed at synchronizing Lok Sabha and assembly elections. This move seeks to streamline the election process across India.

  • The bill has been referred to as the Constitution (One Hundred and Twenty-Ninth Amendment) Bill, 2024.
  • Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal will introduce the bill in Parliament.
  • The bill proposes to amend Article 82(A) and other related articles to allow simultaneous elections.
  • Opposition parties are voicing strong concerns over the potential impact on democratic accountability and federalism.
  • Simultaneous elections are projected to begin in 2034.
“This impractical and anti-democratic move will erase regional voices, erode federalism, and disrupt governance.” – DMK Chief

The introduction of this bill reflects the government's effort to initiate significant electoral reforms while facing substantial opposition regarding its potential implications on democracy.
newTitle: Simultaneous Elections Bill to be Introduced in Lok Sabha

title: NSA Ajit Doval to visit China for talks under Special Representatives mechanism - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ajit Doval to Visit China for Border Dispute Talks

Publication Date: Dec 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

National Security Adviser (NSA) Ajit Doval is set to visit China to further discussions aimed at resolving the longstanding border dispute following recent disengagement on the Line of Actual Control (LAC).

  • Doval’s visit is expected to happen by the end of the year or early January.
  • The Special Representatives mechanism was initiated in 2003 to create a framework for settling the boundary issues.
  • Previous talks occurred to negotiate disengagement of forces after military tensions intensified in April-May 2020.
  • Doval will meet with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi, his counterpart in these discussions.
  • This visit follows a series of high-level meetings between Indian and Chinese leaders aimed at normalizing relations.
“The Special Representatives mechanism was created in 2003 to explore the framework of a boundary settlement.”

The upcoming talks are crucial for addressing key border issues and maintaining stability in India-China relations.
newTitle: Ajit Doval to Visit China for Border Dispute Talks

title: India, China set to hold special representatives’ meeting tomorrow - The Indian Express
summary:
India and China to Hold Special Representatives’ Meeting in Beijing

Publication Date: December 17, 2024

Source: Indian Express

India and China, after recent official talks, are set to hold a Special Representatives’ meeting in Beijing, focusing on boundary issues amid improved relations following troop disengagement in eastern Ladakh.

  • The meeting is scheduled for December 18, 2024.
  • National Security Advisor Ajit Doval will represent India, while Foreign Minister Wang Yi represents China.
  • This dialogue follows the Working Mechanism for Consultation and Coordination (WMCC) talks held in Delhi on December 5.
  • The last Special Representatives’ dialogue occurred in December 2019.
  • Key topics include effective border management and de-escalation following a prolonged standoff.
“They also prepared for the next meeting of the Special Representatives, which is to be held in accordance with the decision of the two leaders in their meeting in Kazan on October 23.”

The upcoming meeting represents a critical step in stabilizing India-China relations, particularly concerning border issues.
newTitle: India and China to Hold Special Representatives’ Meeting in Beijing

title: Higher EPFO Pension: Govt Should Immediately Implement Enhanced Pension Scheme, Says Premachandran - News18
summary:
Higher EPFO Pension: Govt Should Immediately Implement Enhanced Pension Scheme, Says Premachandran

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: News18

N K Premachandran, a Revolutionary Socialist Party MP, has called for the immediate implementation of an enhanced pension scheme as approved by the Supreme Court, allowing existing employees to opt for higher pensions.

  • The Supreme Court ruled on November 4, 2022, allowing existing employees to opt for a higher pension under the Employees’ Pension Scheme (EPS), 1995.
  • Only 8,401 out of 1,748,775 applications have been processed for higher pensions as of August 7, 2024.
  • Premachandran emphasized that employees are entitled to this higher pension and that the government should act swiftly.
  • The EPS 1995 aims to provide financial stability to employees after retirement.
“Employees are entitled to a higher pension under the EPS 1995,” said Premachandran.

The call for immediate action reflects the urgency of meeting the needs of employees who contribute to the EPFO.
newTitle: Govt Urged to Implement Enhanced EPFO Pension Scheme

title: Manoj Manchu Accuses Brother Vishnu Of Endangering His Family: 'It Could Have Led To Lives Lost' - News18
summary:
Manoj Manchu Accuses Brother Vishnu Of Endangering His Family: 'It Could Have Led To Lives Lost'

Date: December 16, 2024
Source: News18

The ongoing feud within the Manchu family has escalated, with Manoj Manchu accusing his elder brother Vishnu of endangering his family by tampering with home generators.

  • Manoj alleges that Vishnu and his associates broke into his home while he was away and sabotaged the generators.
  • They purportedly posed as cake delivery personnel to gain access to the house.
  • Manoj claimed that they mixed diesel and sugar in the generators, causing significant damage.
  • The tampering resulted in a power failure and dangerous electrical fluctuations.
  • He expressed concern for his family's safety, particularly for his mother and nine-month-old daughter.
  • Manoj stated that the incident is part of a troubling pattern of threats and hostility from Vishnu.
“This incident is not an isolated one but part of a growing pattern of threats and hostility,” Manoj said.

In light of these events, Manoj is calling for immediate action from authorities to prevent further incidents and ensure his family's safety.
newTitle: Manoj Manchu Accuses Brother Vishnu Of Endangering His Family: 'It Could Have Led To Lives Lost'

title: India was only an ally: Dhaka unhappy over PM Modi’s Victory Day post - The Times of India

Giving alms to beggars in Indore will now attract FIR - The Times of India
summary:
Giving Alms to Beggars in Indore Will Now Attract FIR

Publication Date: Recent Update | Source: Local News

In a new measure, the authorities in Indore have decided that giving alms to beggars will now attract a First Information Report (FIR). This regulation aims to address the issue of begging in the city more effectively.

  • The decision is part of a broader initiative to manage urban cleanliness and order.
  • Officials believe that providing money to beggars perpetuates the cycle of begging.
  • The local government is promoting welfare schemes to support those in need rather than encouraging street begging.
“This policy is aimed at reducing the number of beggars in the streets and providing them with alternative means of support,” said a local official.

This new law has generated significant discussion among residents about its potential effects on the lives of those who beg for a living.
newTitle: Giving Alms to Beggars in Indore Will Now Attract FIR

title: Bombay High Court slaps ₹50k costs on petition against award of contract to Adani Power - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
Bill on simultaneous elections to Lok Sabha and State Assemblies likely to be introduced in Lower House - The Hindu
summary:
Bill on Simultaneous Elections to Lok Sabha and State Assemblies Likely to Be Introduced in Lower House

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

The Union government is preparing to introduce a bill in the Lok Sabha on December 17, 2024, aiming to establish a framework for conducting simultaneous elections for the Lok Sabha and State Assemblies.

  • The bill is likely to be referred to a Joint Committee of Parliament.
  • The BJP and allies have issued a three-line whip for members to attend the session.
  • Opposition leaders, including M.K. Stalin and Mamata Banerjee, are strongly opposing the bill.
  • The bill includes a provision allowing the President to postpone elections for an Assembly that cannot hold simultaneous polls.
“If the Election Commission is of the opinion that the elections to any Legislative Assembly cannot be conducted along with the general election to the House of the People, it may make a recommendation to the President...”

The bill aims to amend the Constitution to facilitate simultaneous elections, altering several articles, including the introduction of a new article 82A.
newTitle: Bill on Simultaneous Elections to Lok Sabha and State Assemblies Introduced

title: Atul Subhash suicide case: Allahabad HC grants anticipatory bail to Nikita Singhania's uncle - The Times of India
GRAP 4 curbs return in Delhi-NCR as pollution levels rise amid cold wave - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi-NCR Reimposes GRAP 4 Measures as Pollution Levels Surge

Date: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Amid rising pollution levels exacerbated by a cold wave, the Commission for Air Quality Management has reimposed the fourth stage restrictions in the Delhi-National Capital Region.

  • The fourth stage restrictions ban all construction and demolition activities.
  • Entry of trucks carrying non-essential goods into Delhi is restricted.
  • The city's 24-hour average air quality index exceeded 400.
  • Hybrid classes in schools for higher grades have been mandated by the CAQM.
  • The minimum temperature on Monday dropped to 4.5 degrees Celsius.
The national capital's air quality index breached 400 amidst adverse weather conditions.

This situation calls for immediate action to address air quality concerns caused by severe cold and pollution levels.
newTitle: Delhi-NCR Reimposes GRAP 4 Measures as Pollution Levels Surge

title: GRAP-4 curbs reimposed in Delhi-NCR as air quality turns severe - The Times of India
summary:
GRAP-4 curbs reimposed in Delhi-NCR as air quality turns severe

Date & Source: October 2023, Times of India

An increase in air pollution levels in the Delhi-NCR region has prompted the government to reinstate GRAP-4 restrictions aimed at curbing emissions and improving air quality.

  • The imposition of GRAP-4 measures marks a significant response to a sharp decline in air quality levels.
  • Residents are advised to minimize outdoor activities and vehicular movements.
  • Construction activities have also been put on hold to prevent further pollution.
“It is crucial for residents to adhere to the guidelines to protect their health.”

The reinstatement of GRAP-4 is a step towards addressing the persistent air quality challenges faced by the region.
newTitle: GRAP-4 Curbs Reimposed in Delhi-NCR as Air Quality Turns Severe

title: GRAP-4 Reimposed In Delhi As Pollution Level Reaches 'Severe' Category - ABP Live
summary:
GRAP-4 Reimposed In Delhi As Pollution Level Reaches 'Severe' Category

Published on: December 16, 2024

Source: ABP Live

The commission for air quality management has reimposed GRAP-4 restrictions in Delhi as air pollution levels have escalated to critical levels.

  • The air quality index (AQI) in Delhi rose to 399 and breached the 400-mark, classifying it as 'Severe'.
  • GRAP-4 includes a ban on construction activities and the entry of trucks carrying non-essential goods into Delhi.
  • The GRAP measures aim to control the worsening air quality due to unfavorable meteorological conditions.
  • The restrictions also involve controlling vehicle entry based on emissions standards.
"Delhi’s average AQI rose to 399 at 9PM tonight and breached the 400 mark at 10PM. Considering the rise in the AQI of Delhi owing to highly unfavourable meteorological conditions, the CAQM Sub-Committee on GRAP called for an emergency meeting." — Commission for Air Quality Management

The decision comes as air quality deteriorates, affecting the health and well-being of residents and highlighting the ongoing environmental challenges in urban India.
newTitle: GRAP-4 Reimposed In Delhi As Pollution Level Reaches 'Severe' Category

title: GRAP-4 Curbs Imposed In Delhi-NCR As Air Quality Drops To ‘Severe’ Again - News18
summary:
GRAP-4 Curbs Imposed In Delhi-NCR As Air Quality Drops To ‘Severe’ Again

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: News18

The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has implemented Stage IV restrictions under the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) in Delhi-NCR as air quality levels surged past the 400 mark.

  • Delhi recorded a 24-hour average AQI of 379 at 4 PM, rising to 399 by 9 PM and breaching 400 by 10 PM.
  • The recent cold wave has contributed to worsened air quality, with temperatures falling to 4.5 degrees Celsius.
  • Restrictions under GRAP-IV include bans on entry of certain vehicle categories and enhanced work-from-home regulations.
  • Children and vulnerable populations are advised to limit outdoor activities.
“In pursuance of the Hon’ble Supreme Court’s directives, the CAQM Sub Committee hereby invokes the Stage-IV of the Schedule under the GRAP…”

Immediate actions are being taken due to the poor air quality conditions, reflecting an ongoing environmental concern in the region.
newTitle: GRAP-4 Restrictions Imposed in Delhi-NCR Due to Severe Air Quality

‘Have 1,000 Complaints Of Attacks On Minorities’: Arrested Hindu Monk’s Lawyer Arrives In India - News18
summary:
‘Have 1,000 Complaints Of Attacks On Minorities’: Arrested Hindu Monk’s Lawyer Arrives In India

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: News18

Rabindra Ghosh, the lawyer for arrested monk Chinmoy Krishna Prabhu Das, arrived in India for medical treatment and spoke about the dire situation for minorities in Bangladesh.

  • Ghosh mentioned he has over 1,000 complaints of attacks on minorities in Bangladesh.
  • Described the current regime as one that has worsened conditions for minorities.
  • Faced threats and violence while attempting to represent Das in court.
  • Stressed ongoing efforts for the protection of human rights in Bangladesh.
  • Ghosh's visit is also for health check-ups before returning to Bangladesh.
“The situation there is bad, very bad.” - Rabindra Ghosh

This visit sheds light on the ongoing struggles faced by minorities in Bangladesh and the courageous efforts of their advocates.
newTitle: Hindu Monk's Lawyer in India Highlights Minority Attacks in Bangladesh

title: Revanth to Lead Chalo Raj Bhavan Protest - Deccan Chronicle
summary:
Revanth to Lead Chalo Raj Bhavan Protest

Publication Date: December 18

Source: Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee

In response to a nationwide campaign by AICC exposing alleged corruption and inaction of the BJP-led NDA government regarding Gautam Adani, TPCC has announced a protest rally.

  • The rally will start at 11 am from the Indira Gandhi statue on Necklace Road.
  • Participants include Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy, Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka, along with ministers and party officials.
  • TPCC accuses NDA government of overlooking alleged financial irregularities by Adani.
  • Various programmes will be organized nationwide to raise awareness about corruption on December 18.
  • The rally will also address the government's failures in Manipur.
The allegations related to corruption, fraud, money laundering, market manipulation, and criminal charges against Adani have seriously damaged the country’s reputation on the global stage.

The Chalo Raj Bhavan protest is set to spotlight corruption concerns and the responses to the current government's handling of various issues.
newTitle: Revanth to Lead Chalo Raj Bhavan Protest

title: ACB Files Case Against KTR In Formula E Case - Gulte
summary:
ACB Files Case Against KTR In Formula E Case

Published on: 10:15 pm, 16 December 2024

For the last few months, BRS working president, KTR had been under the radar of the investigating agencies in Telangana. The ACB has filed a case against KTR in relation to the Formula E scandal he is allegedly involved in.

  • The ACB accuses KTR of verbally consenting to transfer Rs 55 crore of government funds to foreign entities.
  • Ex-MAUD principal secretary Arvind Kumar admitted to transferring the funds on KTR’s verbal orders.
  • The investigation was instigated by the Telangana cabinet, leading to the ACB's action against KTR.
  • Governor Jishnu Dev Varma granted permission for the ACB to prosecute KTR regarding financial irregularities during the Hyderabad Formula E races held in February 2023.
  • ACB is expected to summon KTR for investigation soon.
“At this rate, it shouldn’t be long before the ACB summons KTR for investigation in the Formula E scandal.”

This case marks a significant escalation in the scrutiny of KTR’s alleged involvement in financial misconduct within the government.
newTitle: ACB Files Case Against KTR In Formula E Case

title: Parliament Winter Session: 'One Nation, One Poll' bill likely to be introduced in LS tomorrow - Hindustan Times
Nirbhaya's mother says ‘daughters still not safe’ 12 years after Delhi gangrape case - Hindustan Times
summary:
Nirbhaya's Mother Speaks Out on Women's Safety 12 Years After Gangrape Case

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Asha Devi, mother of the 2012 Delhi gangrape victim, expressed her grief and concern regarding women’s safety in India, stating that despite tougher laws, changes have not been realized in society.

  • Asha Devi highlighted the lack of safety for women in India even after 12 years since her daughter's tragedy.
  • She criticized the criminal justice system for its inefficiency in handling cases of violence against women.
  • During her emotional speech at the National Convention on Prevention of Violence Against Women and Children, she recounted her distress over the ongoing peril women face.
  • Devi mentioned a recent case of a doctor’s murder, underscoring the persistent issues of violence and inadequate investigation.
  • She called for a reevaluation of the approaches towards women's safety by government bodies.
“Even after 12 years, the circumstances have not changed. The daughters of the country are not safe.” - Asha Devi

The ongoing struggle for justice emphasizes the need for more robust societal changes to ensure women's safety, as articulated by Asha Devi, who continues to grapple with her daughter's loss while advocating for a safer future for all women.
newTitle: Nirbhaya's Mother Speaks Out on Women's Safety 12 Years After Gangrape Case

title: India, China Special Representatives to hold talks in Beijing on December 18: Chinese Foreign Ministry - The Hindu
summary:
India, China Special Representatives to hold talks in Beijing on December 18: Chinese Foreign Ministry

Published on: December 16, 2024 09:45 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

The Special Representatives of India and China will meet in Beijing on December 18, 2024, to discuss restoring bilateral ties after a recent agreement to disengage troops in eastern Ladakh.

  • Director Wang Yi and NSA Ajit Doval will hold the 23rd meeting on the China-India Boundary Question.
  • The meeting follows a five-year gap since the last one in 2019.
  • Efforts aim to normalize relations strained since April 2020.
  • Trade remains the only area of cooperation amidst rising tensions.
“The two sides have reached resolutions on relevant matters, which China speaks highly of.” - Chinese Foreign Ministry

The upcoming talks are crucial for both nations to build upon recently agreed resolutions and enhance diplomatic relations.
newTitle: India and China to Discuss Border Issues in Beijing

title: KTR Faces Corruption Case Over Alleged Irregularities In 2023 Formula E Race - NDTV
summary:
KTR Faces Corruption Case Over Alleged Irregularities In 2023 Formula E Race

Date: March 26, 2024 | Source: NDTV

A corruption case has been filed against KT Rama Rao, the former minister of Telangana, over alleged irregularities linked to the 2023 Formula E race held in Hyderabad.

  • The Anti-Corruption Bureau alleges a transfer of ₹55 crore to the event organizers occurred on the verbal orders of Mr. Rao.
  • Former principal secretary Arvind Kumar admitted to transferring funds without cabinet approval and circumventing the Election Commission's permission.
  • The payment allegedly occurred in pounds without Reserve Bank of India clearance.
  • Mr. Rao claims he is being targeted by the current Congress government following a political shift.
  • The next Formula E scheduled for February 2024 was canceled after the Congress came to power.
“I am being targeted by the Congress government” - KT Rama Rao

The ongoing investigation raises questions about the accountability of political figures in financial matters and their oversight in public fund management.
newTitle: KTR Faces Corruption Case Over Alleged Irregularities In 2023 Formula E Race

title: 5 Tips To Drive On Snow-Covered Roads In Himachal Pradesh - News18
summary:
5 Tips To Drive On Snow-Covered Roads In Himachal Pradesh

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: News18

With the winter season underway, regions of Himachal Pradesh are experiencing snowfall, making driving conditions challenging. Here are essential tips for navigating snowy roads safely.

  • Use Snow Chains: Always use snow chains on your tyres for extra grip.
  • Reduce Tyre Pressure: Lower the tyre pressure to increase traction.
  • Maintain Distance and Choose the Right Gear: Keep a safe distance and use second gear for better control.
  • Control Speed and Avoid Sudden Braking: Keep your speed below 30 kmph and use brakes sparingly.
  • Pack Essentials: Carry emergency supplies like medicines and food.
"Travel only after the sun comes out" - Deputy Commissioner Kullu Torul S Ravish advises tourists.

By following these tips, travelers can ensure a safer journey in the beautiful yet treacherous snowy landscapes of Himachal Pradesh.
newTitle: 5 Tips To Drive On Snow-Covered Roads In Himachal Pradesh

title: 'Won't let anyone threaten India's security': Sri Lankan president's promise to PM Modi - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sri Lankan President's Commitment to India's Security During New Delhi Visit

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: HT News Desk

Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Disanayaka has pledged during his visit to India that no force will be allowed to use Sri Lankan territory to threaten India's security, emphasizing strong defense cooperation between the nations.

  • The meeting between Disanayaka and Prime Minister Modi aims to strengthen ties amid growing concerns about China's influence in the region.
  • Disanayaka reiterated Sri Lanka's commitment to support India, fostering further cooperation.
  • India and Sri Lanka are planning new initiatives, including an electricity grid and a petroleum pipeline, to enhance economic relations.
  • The backdrop of the visit includes Sri Lanka's economic crisis and China's aggressive presence in the Indo-Pacific.
“The cooperation with India will certainly flourish and I want to reassure our continued support for India,” Disanayaka stated at a press briefing.

The visit is significant as it symbolizes the strengthening of India-Sri Lanka relations in light of regional security concerns, particularly regarding China's actions in the Indian Ocean.
newTitle: Sri Lankan President's Commitment to India's Security During New Delhi Visit

title: Parliament Winter Session Day 17 LIVE Updates: ‘PM Modi should apologise to people for misleading them by ‘twisting’ Nehru’s letter to states,’ says Mallikarjun Kharge in RS - The Indian Express
summary:
Parliament Winter Session Day 17: Kharge Criticizes PM Modi for Misleading Remarks

Date: December 2024, Source: Indian Express

In a session of the Rajya Sabha on Monday, Leader of the Opposition Mallikarjun Kharge sharply criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for allegedly misleading the public.

  • Kharge accused Modi of distorting a historical letter from Jawaharlal Nehru to state governments.
  • He suggested that Modi should focus on contemporary achievements rather than living in the past.
  • Kharge condemned the BJP for using empty rhetoric to deceive citizens.
  • PM Modi defended his government's constitutional amendments during a Lok Sabha debate, claiming they aim to empower rather than consolidate power.
  • Introduction of the "One Nation, One Election" bills has been postponed until later this week.
"PM Modi should apologise to people for misleading them by 'twisting' Nehru’s letter to states." - Mallikarjun Kharge

The ongoing debate reflects significant tensions between the government and the opposition regarding historical narratives and current policies.
newTitle: Parliament Winter Session Day 17: Kharge Criticizes PM Modi for Misleading Remarks

title: After Rahul vs Mamata leadership tussle, it is now EVM divide in opposition INDIA bloc - The Times of India
summary:
After Rahul vs Mamata leadership tussle, it is now EVM divide in opposition INDIA bloc

Publication Date: Unknown Source: Unknown

This article discusses the recent divide within the opposition INDIA bloc regarding Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) in the wake of leadership tensions between Rahul Gandhi and Mamata Banerjee.

  • The recent leadership tussle in the opposition highlighted tensions between key figures.
  • There is a growing divide concerning the trust in EVMs as a voting mechanism.
  • Concerns have been raised about election integrity impacting the opposition's unity.
"The tussle has raised questions about the future direction of the opposition coalition."

The current situation underscores deep-seated issues within the opposition, raising concerns for the upcoming electoral processes.
newTitle: EVM Divide in Opposition INDIA Bloc After Leadership Tussle
